instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Hi.

[U][B]History[/B][/U]
Liquid damage, nothing major.
Removed J6100, replaced everything around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, replaced everything around <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.

Board powered on, removed MagSafe, plugged back the MagSafe, no S4 no power on.
With no IO cable plugged to J9500 board will power with S4 rails, CPU gets hot, blah.
Tried new flex IO and IO board.


[U][B]Rails[/B][/U]
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.2 (this should be 8.6 right?.. Only have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> for reference)
3V42 = 3V42
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3V3
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V
PPVRTC = 3V3
<SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Is <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> present? This comes from the SMC.Also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should be 8.4-8.5v, 8.1-8.2v is indicative of SMC being fucked or the data line between the SMC and the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> being bad. 

I don't get the blah part, is this only turning on without the I/O cable plugged in?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 8600"]Is <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> present? This comes from the SMC.Also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should be 8.4-8.5v, 8.1-8.2v is indicative of SMC being fucked or the data line between the SMC and the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> being bad.

I don't get the blah part, is this only turning on without the I/O cable plugged in?

[/QUOTE]

Replaced the SMC.... All good now.....

Funny, the very next machine I opened up showed the exact same 8.2V PPBUS__G3H, which turned out to be <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
Good bit of info, thank you Louis :)
